JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) are represented by their Agent , PERSON , PERSON , of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant , an engineer by profession , contributed to the compulsory general pension scheme and the optional supplementary pension scheme of the former GPE .

On DATE ORG for Salaried Employees ( ORG für DATE hereinafter referred to as “ ORG ” ) issued a declaratory decision on the applicant ’s contribution periods ( ORG ) and the basis for the calculation of his pension .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s objection .
On DATE the applicant lodged a claim with ORG .
In decisions of DATE and DATE ORG granted the applicant a pension , the amount of which was based on the impugned decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s claim against ORG decisions as unfounded .
On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG arguing that he was entitled to a higher pension .
On DATE the applicant moreover lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG making the same complaints .
On DATE the applicant requested ORG to stay the proceedings in view of the constitutional complaint , or alternatively to suspend them .
On DATE the applicant repeated his motion for a suspension of the proceedings . He also announced that he would file further observations if it was rejected .
On DATE ORG rejected this motion .

In a letter dated DATE the applicant again pointed out that he requested the proceedings to be stayed or suspended . He also announced that further submissions would be made on decisions of principle rendered by ORG in the meantime .
In a letter of DATE the applicant again referred to his previous motions aimed at having the proceedings stayed or suspended .
In DATE ORG requested the applicant to give further particulars of his claims and to indicate whether , as announced in the letter of DATE , further submissions would be made .
In DATE and DATE it reminded the applicant to submit his further observations .
In DATE and DATE the applicant filed further submissions and also requested ORG to seek a preliminary ruling from ORG .
On DATE ORG refused to admit the applicant ’s constitutional complaint .
On DATE the applicant lodged the present application . In his first letter to the ORG he complained about the decision of ORG and the unfairness of the proceedings .
In DATE and again in DATE ORG requested the applicant to state his position regarding a friendly settlement .
On DATE the applicant reiterated his request to stay the proceedings in view of the application he had lodged with the ORG .
On DATE ORG scheduled the hearing for DATE .

The applicant then twice filed a motion for the hearing to be cancelled and the proceedings stayed on account of the fact that his complaint was still pending before the ORG . He submitted that failure to do so would amount to an “ abuse of rights ” with regard to him . ORG rejected both requests ( decisions of CARDINAL and DATE ) .
On DATE it dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . It also refused leave to appeal on points of law .
On DATE ORG rejected as inadmissible the applicant ’s appeal against the refusal to grant leave to appeal .
